value.title: Venture capital is not an asset class, says Sequoia’s Roelof Botha
value.content: Sequoia's managing partner Roelof Botha noted that there are currently 3,000 venture firms in the United States, while there were just 1,000 when he joined Sequoia 20 years ago.

value.title: CEO of Alphabet’s X, Astro Teller, on what makes a moonshot
value.content: Teller says X has a 2% hit rate, which means that most of the things the company tries don't work out, and that's okay.

value.title: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan says AI will shorten our workweek
value.content: Zoom CEO Eric Yuan says that, in a few years, we should be working a 3-4 day workweek because of AI.

value.title: Roelof Botha explains why Sequoia supports Shaun Maguire after COO quit
value.content: Sequoia's managing partner Roelof Botha defended his colleague's controversial comments that sparked an online backlash, arguing that the VC firm needs "spiky" people.

value.title: Defense startup Pytho AI wants to turbocharge military mission planning and it will show off its tech at Disrupt 2025
value.content: Pytho AI wants to compress mission planning from days to mere minutes.

value.title: Strong by Form will show its ultralight engineered wood at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: Strong by Form has designed a structural floor piece that can span longer distances than existing engineered wood, making it a replacement for steel or concrete. At the same time, the product is lighter than all three.

value.title: MacroCycle found a shortcut for plastic recycling — catch it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: MacroCycle's approach to recycling dramatically reduces the amount of energy needed to produce new material, potentially lowering costs to the point where it could compete with virgin plastic.

value.title: Mbodi will show how it can train a robot using AI agents at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: Mbodi users prompt the software with natural language, and its cluster of AI agents works to make training easier.

value.title: Glīd is building an autonomous shortcut to move freight from road to rail — catch it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: Damoa pinpointed the problem: the complex, multi-step process moving a container from a ship to a freight train. He founded Glīd Technologies to try and solve it.

value.title: Waymo’s co-CEO on the challenge of scaling robotaxis safely
value.content: Waymo co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana believes the robotaxi company can increase road safety by reaching scale.

value.title: Waymo co-CEO on robotaxi vandalism: ‘We’re not standing for it’
value.content: Waymo co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana opened up at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 about the vandalism of its cars and how the company pushes back on government surveillance requests.

value.title: Robotaxi companies must do more to prove safety, Waymo co-CEO says
value.content: Waymo co-CEO Tekedra Mawakana urged rival autonomous vehicle companies to be more transparent about their safety data.

value.title: Amazon reportedly plans to cut around 30,000 corporate jobs
value.content: Amazon could be planning to cut up to 30,000 corporate positions starting on Tuesday.

value.title: OpenAI says over a million people talk to ChatGPT about suicide weekly
value.content: OpenAI released data on just how many of ChatGPT's users are facing mental health challenges, and how it's addressing them.

value.title: Fitbit’s revamped app, with Gemini-powered health coach, rolls out to Premium users
value.content: Called “Coach,” this feature is designed to be your all-in-one fitness trainer, sleep coach, and health and wellness advisor.

value.title: New corporate espionage claims emerge, centered on two highly valued 401(k) admin startups
value.content: Two 401(k) management unicorns, Human Interest and Guideline, are squaring off in federal court with allegations so brazen they're embarrassing.

value.title: COI Energy solves a conundrum: Letting businesses sell unused electricity — catch it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: Large enterprises routinely buy  more electricity than they use.  COI Energy has a patented platform that lets them sell and share.

value.title: Skyline Nav AI’s software can guide you anywhere, without GPS — find it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: The company's so-called Pathfinder software can look at almost anything — buildings, tree-lined roads, even aerial views — and quickly match it to a database and generate real-time navigation.

value.title: Oxford spinout RADiCAIT uses AI to make diagnostic imaging more affordable and accessible — catch it at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: “What we really do is we took the most constrained, complex, and costly medical imaging solution in radiology, and we supplanted it with what is the most accessible, simple and affordable, which is CT,” Sean Walsh, RADiCAIT’s CEO told TechCrunch.

value.title: Miraqules will showcase its blood clotting technology at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
value.content: India-based Miraqules developed a nanotechnology that mimics blood clotting proteins to quickly stop heavy bleeding.
